Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2009 09:31PM Cheryl60 wrote: I had a lumpectomy with rads last year.  I was "Told" that I would be taking Femara.  I did for 3 months UNTIL I did a whole lot of research and sole searching and decided enough is enough.  Luckily my oncologist agreed that for 'some' women, these drugs just do not work well with them.  He also told me that the Femara was just an 'added' insurance policy and the chances of BC reoccurring were not that much different taking the drug or NOT taking the drug.  I opted to NOT take it.  It was largely a matter of quality of life. Yukky side effects I was not willing to live with on the very small chance that it would keep me from getting this again in 5 years. I made this decision however, with great thought and contemplation and lots of research.  Each of us has to come to this type of decision on our own.. Each of us is so different in this journey we are all on.  As I said on another post, after we are dx'd with this BC, our heads are in such a dither and our world has been turned up side down, it does take a while to come to grips and research all about this.  Of course I have never been the type of person who just takes anything at face value, i HAVE to research on my own and make up my own mind.  I still have a hard time accepting that most drs. think treatment for BC patients is a one size fits all...Just can't go along with that.  So far, so good.  I am feeling more and more like my old self as each month goes by.  Hopefully this will keep on for good and NO MORE problems with BC. Hopefully NO more probs with BC for ALL of us!  Cheryl

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2009 08:39PM Cheryl60 wrote: I finished 6 weeks of rads 12/15/08...so its only been 8 months..and did fine - was a bit swollen, and sore and quite a bit of redness, but was feeling so well lately that is until last Friday...Here is Seattle we've had a bit of heat wave..was high 90's and 100 which is totally weird for us and NO ONE has airconditioning here...so we suffered and sweated alot for 5 days...anyway, on last friday my breast got really sore, very warm, and RED..up to my collar bone and down onto my tummy.  Almost a welt like look to it.  I was NOT out in the sun at all (not dumb) and i think this is a reaction to the rads and the damage it did to my cells in the breast and surrounding areas.  It truely is the gift that keeps on giving this damn BC.!!!  I did call the on-call oncologist saturday morning and she basically shrugged her shoulders and said just watch it and if it gets worse go into ER.  Somedays you just want to scream!  No answers re: the treatments they throw at us.  Just a guessing game for all!  Has anyone else experienced anything such as this?  I'd love to hear you guys feed back.  Thanks, Cheryl
